title: proposal: make error messages show with user's code as context
body:
I am wondering if I am not the only one wanting something more from the go tool and its error messages. It would be amazing if error messages could be more visual like:

 ```bash
error: character literal may only contain one codepoint: ')
 --> hello.rs:2:24
  |
2 | 	println!("Hello World"');
  | 	                      ^^

```

I must say kudos to the Rust team for what really is an amazing approach. Is this something a community member would be allowed to implement or something the core team isn't interested in having fixed? As far as I know the go tool is written in go, meaning that I am both willing and able to give this a shot. I just want to verify that this is something I won't be wasting my time doing.
